title: Valentine's Day Spending Data
text: package includes four datasets: gifts_age, gifts_gender, historical_full_spending, historical_gifts_trends_percent_buying. datasets show annual trends people plan celebrate Valentine’s Day past decade, including total expected spending, average per-person spending, preferred gift types, broken age gender.” data can accessed loading Valentinetrend calling object gifts_age, alternatively using Valentinetrend::gifts_age want analyse Valentine’s Day spending trends different age group.

title: Valentine's Day Spending Data
code: library(Valentinetrend)  # Load the gifts_age dataset head(gifts_age)  # Alternatively, use the full namespace head(Valentinetrend::gifts_age) library(Valentinetrend) library(knitr) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(RColorBrewer) library(tidyr)

title: Valentine's Day Spending Data
text: examples analyses using datasets provided. ’ll learn perform basic data exploration create visualizations using package! , use historical_full_spending dataset create combined bar line chart showing total expected average per person spending 2010 2022.  also create separate section dataset, showing different analyses visualizations.
code:
ggplot(historical_full_spending, aes(x = Year)) + geom_bar( aes(y = PerPerson, text = paste0("Year: ", Year, "
Per Person Spend: $", round(PerPerson, 2))), stat = "identity", fill = "hotpink", alpha = 0.7 ) + geom_line( aes(y = total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions * 10), color = "mediumvioletred", size = 1 ) + geom_point( aes(y = total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions * 10, text = paste0("Year: ", Year, "
Total Spend: $", total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions, "B")), color = "mediumvioletred", size = 2 ) + geom_text( aes(y = total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions * 10 + 10, label = paste0("$", total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions, "B")), size = 3, fontface = "bold" ) + labs( title = "Valentine's Day Spending Plans", x = "Year", y = "Spending ($)" ) + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 16)) + annotate("point", x = 2013.9, y = -12, color = "hotpink", size = 3) + annotate("text", x = 2015.1, y = -12, label = "Per Person Spend", size = 3, color = "black") + annotate("point", x = 2017, y = -12, color = "mediumvioletred", size = 3) + annotate("text", x = 2017.8, y = -12, label = "Total Spend", size = 3, color = "black")

what: Spending trends on gifts breaking down by age
title: Valentine's Day Spending Data
text: gifts_age dataset provides insights spending trends different age groups. , create line chart visualize gift preferences among different age groups.
code: # Use pivot_longer to reshape the data gifts_age_long <- gifts_age %>%   pivot_longer(cols = Candy:GiftCards,                 names_to = "GiftCategory",                 values_to = "Percentage")  # Create the line plot for gift categories ggplot(gifts_age_long, aes(x = Age, y = Percentage, color = GiftCategory, group = GiftCategory)) +   geom_line(size = 1) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   labs(title = "Spending on Different Gifts By Age Group",        x = "Age Group",         y = "Percentage (%)",        color = "Gift Category") +   theme_minimal()+   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Accent")

title: Valentine's Day Spending Data
text: Alternatively, can create interactive chart using plotly package, demonstrated Shiny app. can launch app shown explore engaging interactive plots provide dynamic user-friendly experience! example, add plotly functionality hover info chart, use following code: guide demonstrates use Valentinetrend package analyze Valentine’s Day spending trends. can also explore additional datasets (gifts_gender, historical_gifts_trends_percent_buying) insights.
code: Valentinetrend::launch_app() # Copy the code from the 'historical_full_spending' combined chart # Example: # p <- ggplot(historical_full_spending, aes(x = Year)) +  #   ... + #   theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 16))  # To make the chart interactive, add the following code: ggplotly(p, tooltip = "text") %>%   layout(     hovermode = "closest"   ) %>%   style(hoverinfo = "none", traces = 4)

title: Valentine's Day Consumer Spending Trends from 2010 to 2022
text: package contains comprehensive data Valentine’s Day spending trends past decade, provided National Retail Federation(NRF), surveyed consumers annually plan celebrate Valentine’s Day. includes datasets capture total expected spending, average spending per person, spending gift type, consumer-preferred gifts, broken age gender. package designed help users, especially retailers, analyze consumer behavior spending patterns Valentine’s Day. package provides following datasets: ?gift_age: Shows percentage spending different gift categories, broken age groups. ?gift_gender: Shows percentage spending different gift categories, broken gender. ?historical_full_spending: Provides total expected spending, average spending per person average spending per person different gifts 2010 2022. ?historical_gift_trends_percent_buying: Provides consumer trends gift-buying, showing percentage people buying specific gift categories years.

title: Valentine's Day Consumer Spending Trends from 2010 to 2022
text: can install development version Valentinetrend directly GitHub using remotes package :

title: Valentine's Day Consumer Spending Trends from 2010 to 2022
text: take deeper dive data last 10 years, use interactive charts explore demographic breakdown total spending, average spending spending per type gift. can explore insights using Valentinetrend::launch_app()launch Shiny app, offers range interactive plots detailed analysis. can see pkgdown site following link Valentinetrend, can find detailed information package.

SpendingCelebrating Percent spending money celebrating Valentines Day Candy Average percent spending candy Flowers Average percent spending flowers Jewelry Average percent spending jewelry GreetingCards Average percent spending greeting cards EveningOut Average percent spending evening Clothing Average percent spending clothing GiftCards Average percent spending gift cards
